_header: A Jews child in Buterie while by old daw
_description: The little Jew, a miracle of the Virgin, in the South English Legendary — in couplets

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
A Giewes child in a time while bi olde daweWiþ Cristen
                    children ofte pleied as children wile fawe…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…Elles þei hadden shrewen beo ffor þe miracle of
                    þilk childeMani miracles man may telle of oure lady suete &
                    mylde
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

OxfTri57.First Lines:
A gewes child in o tyme whyse be olde dawewith cristene children
                    ofte playde as children willeþ fawe…
OxfTri57.Last Lines:
…Elles hy hadde scherewen y beo for þe meracle of þulke
                    childeManye meracles me may ȝut telle of oure leuedy swete &
                    mylde

CULAdd3039.First Lines:
A Jewes childe in Bitury somtyme as storyȝ sayWith crestyn
                    childre oft he ȝode amange þaim to playOn þe Pasche day it
                    befell þat cristen childre gon draghVn to þe kirke with cristen
                    folke as it was þer laghe…
CULAdd3039.Last Lines:
…Þis miracle verraly befell of þis ilk
                    childeÞurgh vertu of our swete lady þat euermore is meke &
                    mylde

CamCCC145.First Lines:
A Giwes child in buturie wile bi olde daweWiþ cristene
                    childrene ofte pleide as children wolleþ ȝute vawe…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…Elles hi hadde ssrewen i be for miracle of þulke
                    childeOf mo miracle me may ȝute telle of oure leuedi swete &
                    milde
CamCCC145.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 227.

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
A Gyewes child in Bytinye som tyme by olde daweWiþ cristene
                    children pleyde as children wolleþ ffawe…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Elles hi hadde schrewen ybeo nere miracle of þulke
                    childeOf mo miracles ich wolle ȝou telle of oure lady swete &
                    mylde

BLCottCleoDIX.First Lines:
[A] Giewes child in butterne iwhile bi old daweWiþ cristen
                    children ofte he pleide as children wolleþ fawe…
BLCottCleoDIX.Last Lines:
…Elles hi hadde schrewen ibeo for miracle of þulc
                    childeOf mo miracles me mai telle ȝut of marie swete &
                    milde
BLCottCleoDIX.Note:
Folio number reflects the most recent foliation. Space left for enlarged
                    ‘A’, which was left blank.

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: A Iwes child in buterie som time be olde dauewit cristin children ofte pleide os children wollet ȝut fawe…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …elles hi hadde schreuen ibe for miracle of Vilke childeof mo miracles me mai ȝut telle of our ladi suete & milde
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum Ciii” added to right margin by later hand (f. 301v).

BLEge2891.First Lines: A Giwes child in buturie wile bi olde daweWiþ cristene children ofte pleide as children wolleþ ȝute fawe…
BLEge2891.Last Lines: …Elles hi hadde ssrewen ibeo nere miracle of þulke childeOf mo miracle ichelle ȝut telle of oure leuedi swete & milde

BLHar2277.First Lines: A gywes child in o tyme while bi olde daweWiþ cristene childerne ofte pleide as childerne wolleþ ȝut fawe…
BLHar2277.Last Lines: …Elles hit hadde schrewon ibeo for miracle of þulke childeMeni miracles me mai ȝut telle of oure leuedi suete & milde
